page.title: 08Elsenham CofE Primary School
page.content: The school is situated roughly in the middle of Elsenham on the main road which runs through the village. It was built on its present site in 1863 but has been modernised since. The first formal education was provided for girls only at Elsenham Hall by the lady of the house, Mrs Rush. A school house was then built in Robin Hood Road and Mrs Rush taught there. Indeed it was Mrs Rush who first provided the money for the building of the first permanent school in 1863. After the building of the school the wealthier villagers planted holly trees around so that the children were not seen; holly trees were chosen because they were evergreen. The school in 1985 has 166 pupils between the age of 4 and 11. In 1983 a new school hall was built and this
